records.recordtype: Y-Time exceptions (missed time punches) documentation retained by department.
records.description: Retain department copies of supporting documentation for 2 years, then destroy.

records.recordtype: Academic unit reviews / educational support unit reviews

commonrecords.recordtype: Academic unit reviews / educational support unit reviews
commonrecords.description: Retain for 1 review cycle (generally 7 years), then transfer 1 copy of self-studies, final reports and related communications to University Archives. Destroy remaining records.

commonrecords.recordtype: Accreditation records, reports and self-evaluations.
commonrecords.description: Retain for 1 accreditation cycle, then transfer 1 copy of self-studies, final reports and communications to the University Records Center for Archival review. Destroy remaining documentation.

commonrecords.recordtype: Challenge exams.
commonrecords.description: For records not retained in online system, destroy department copies of completed exams after 2 years; retain incomplete exam results for 5 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Course materials & outlines (may include syllabi, course descriptions, and original exams.
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review, if not already retained in Learning Suite or Syllabi.byu.edu.

commonrecords.recordtype: Course/Faculty evaluations.
commonrecords.description: Retain indefinitely, if not stored in online ratings system.

commonrecords.recordtype: Curriculum records (may include course proposals, course revisions, course requests, and curriculum committee minutes).
commonrecords.description: Retain permanently, if not already maintained in online system, e.g. Learning Suite. Submit curriculum committee minutes to University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Exams (administered) and coursework not returned to students.
commonrecords.description: Retain 1 year after end of semester administered, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Senior surveys & summaries (Graduating Student Exit Interviews).
commonrecords.description: Retain surveys for 5 years, if not stored online by senior survey system, then destroy.  Transfer 1 copy of summaries to the University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Student files retained by dept. (Academic Advisement Records) â graduate & undergrad.
commonrecords.description: Retain 5 years after graduation or 8 years after last enrolled, then destroy. (Retain records associated with licensing and professional certifications permanently).

commonrecords.recordtype: Job descriptions.
commonrecords.description: Official job descriptions are retained permanently by Human Resource Services. Destroy department duplicates when no longer needed by department.

commonrecords.recordtype: Recruitment files, including applications, application notes and search committee records.
commonrecords.description: If hired, add to employeeâs file. If not hired, destroy initial application, resume and letters of reference in 2 years.  Retain remaining information, interview notes and committee records for 2 years, then destroy when no longer needed by department.

commonrecords.recordtype: Employee files retained by Department â Admin, Staff and Students.
commonrecords.description: Retain information originated by department indefinitely. Destroy remaining information 6 years after termination.

commonrecords.recordtype: Employee files retained by department â Students.
commonrecords.description: Retain information originated by department indefinitely. Destroy remaining information 6 years after departure from department.

commonrecords.recordtype: Annual and summary reports.
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival Review, if not submitted to college/division.

commonrecords.recordtype: Contracts and agreements.
commonrecords.description: Retain 6 years after expiration of contract or agreement, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Off-campus activities and events. (may include press releases, newspaper clippings, photographs, recordings, presentation materials and handouts, schedules of speakers and activities, registration and attendee lists, etc.).
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Meeting Minutes, agendas and correspondence. Records documenting decisions and significant actions. Normally from deans, department heads and above.
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Policies and Procedures department.
commonrecords.description: Retain 6 years after superseded, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Projects and studies.
commonrecords.description: Retain for 3 years, then transfer 1 copy of final, published reports and studies to the University Records Center for Archival review.  Destroy remaining information.

commonrecords.recordtype: Routine administrative support: weekly staff meeting notes, calendars, memos, mailing lists, schedules and routine correspondence.
commonrecords.description: Destroy when no longer needed by department. These records are normally retained by department for 3 years.

commonrecords.recordtype: Strategic planning records.
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Faculty employment files (including contracts, awards, and publications).
commonrecords.description: Retain Indefinitely. Awards and publications are available online.

commonrecords.recordtype: Faculty annual reviews (Faculty Performance Development Plans).
commonrecords.description: Retain Indefinitely.

commonrecords.recordtype: Faculty biographical information, CVs, and awards.
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review, if not retained in Faculty Profile System.

commonrecords.recordtype: Faculty personal & professional papers (including presentation notes, career-related information).
commonrecords.description: Not to be submitted to University Records Center. Contact Special Collections (dainan_skeem@byu.edu) for possible inclusion into Professional Papers program.

commonrecords.recordtype: Rank & Status records.
commonrecords.description: Digital copies from the Rank and Status system are retained indefinitely by the Faculty Personnel Office. âPaper Onlyâ copies should be retained by department indefinitely.

commonrecords.recordtype: Research data (including questionnaires and surveys).
commonrecords.description: Research data is to be retained by faculty, as specified by grant or research project, normally 5 years, then destroy. Do not submit to the University Records Center.

commonrecords.recordtype: Research proposals and grants.
commonrecords.description: Retain for 6 years after close of contract (retain longer if specified by grant or research project), then destroy. Retain denied proposals for 3 years, then destroy. These records are normally retained by ORCA and the Deanâs Office.

commonrecords.recordtype: Deposits, including deposit reports and cash receipts (CASHNet).
commonrecords.description: Retain supporting documentation from CASHNet deposits and transactions for current year + 6, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Budget adjustments, submitted by departments.
commonrecords.description: Retain budget adjustment supporting documentation for current year + 1, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Budget planning (annual financial planning documentation).
commonrecords.description: Retain for 6 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Budget reports (monthly).
commonrecords.description: These reports are available online and do not need to be printed or retained by departments.

commonrecords.recordtype: Endowment accounts.
commonrecords.description: Retain department endowment records permanently.

commonrecords.recordtype: Fundraising records.
commonrecords.description: Retain for current year + 6, then transfer 1 copy of summary report of activity to the University Records Center for Archival review, then destroy remaining records.

commonrecords.recordtype: Restricted gift records~~~
commonrecords.description: Retain for current year + 6 beyond when Donor Restricted Funds have been fully expended, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: General accounting records, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash management, bank statements, cancelled checks, check registers, interuniversity accounting, general ledgers.
commonrecords.description: Retain for current year + 6, then destroy. If these receipts have been submitted to Y-Expense, retain for only 1 year.

commonrecords.recordtype: Inventory records and logs of capital equipment.
commonrecords.description: Retain for current year + 6, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Journal Entry supporting documentation submitted by department.
commonrecords.description: Retain supporting documentation for current year + 1, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Purchasing & travel receipts, expense receipts, P-Card receipts, Fast Track documentation and Y-Expense documentation.
commonrecords.description: Upload into Y-Expense, retain for 1 year, then destroy. It is recommended to save some original receipts for warranty purposes or to document foreign travel.

commonrecords.recordtype: Scholarships records.
commonrecords.description: For records not stored in online scholarship system, retain awarded scholarships for 6 years after graduation, retain denied scholarship applications for 2 years, and retain awarded athletic scholarships for 10 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Sick and vacation tracking documentation retained by department.
commonrecords.description: Retain department copies of supporting documentation for 2 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Work orders, BYU Store orders, print & mail services, physical facilities billings, OIT billings, central stores, testing services, and other department copies of records maintained by the originating departments.
commonrecords.description: Retain copies of internal billing records until no longer needed by department, then destroy. These duplicate records are normally retained no longer than 2 years.

commonrecords.recordtype: Y-Time exceptions (missed time punches) documentation retained by department.
commonrecords.description: Retain department copies of supporting documentation for 2 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Student certifications and licensing.
commonrecords.description: Retain indefinitely.

commonrecords.recordtype: Internship Records.
commonrecords.description: Retain 5 years, then destroy.

commonrecords.recordtype: Research (published) and publications.
commonrecords.description: Submit published research to ScholarsArchive. Do not transfer to the University Records Center.

commonrecords.recordtype: Department Newsletters and Histories
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to the University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Publications produced by department. (including: advertisements & flyers, brochures,  newsletters, magazines, newspaper clippings, posters, programs, published speeches).
commonrecords.description: Permanent. Transfer 1 copy to University Records Center for Archival review.

commonrecords.recordtype: Waivers (Risk Management waivers).
commonrecords.description: Retain permanently.
